# PTD Today Forward Watchlist (Rest of Year • Headline Signals Last 30 Days)

---

## 1) Themes to Watch
- Offshore wind projects facing regulatory and ownership changes (e.g., Orsted challenge, Apollo co-ownership of Hornsea 3)
- Solar deployment growth and pricing pressure in China, US, UK, and India, including policy-driven domestic content rules
- Data center and subsea cable vulnerability to geopolitical tensions (e.g., Finnish police seize ship suspected of cutting a subsea cable)
- AI economics and applications in renewables (floating PV digital twins) and semiconductors highlighted by industry leaders
- Oil & gas geopolitical risks linked to Venezuela impacting supply and US interests
- Semiconductor manufacturing in flux with Intel’s Arizona fab and fluctuating module pricing in China

---

## 2) What to Monitor Next

### Grid / Renewables
- Effects of policy and regulatory challenges on offshore wind projects in the US and UK (Orsted, Hornsea 3)
- UK solar CFDs and US solar market trajectory toward 737.8 GW by 2035, with pricing developments in China modules near CNY 1/W
- India’s domestic content mandate in battery storage and expanding solar manufacturing capacity (Waaree Energies, Tata Power)

### Oil & Gas
- US strikes and political instability in Venezuela influencing oil supply security and geopolitical dynamics

### Data Centers & AI
- Security and operational risks to subsea cable infrastructure amid geopolitical conflicts (Finnish cable incident)
- AI's evolving role in renewable energy management and semiconductor industry economics (Plexo Capital, Deepwater insights)

### Semiconductors
- Intel’s Arizona fab status and China's wafer pricing trends as indicators of chip supply chain and manufacturing resilience

### Critical Minerals
- Not enough information in the headlines to specify critical minerals signals

---

## 3) Regions / Companies Appearing Repeatedly
- China: solar manufacturing, offshore wind single-unit capacity leadership
- US: solar market expansion, AI economic insights, subsea cable geopolitical concerns
- UK: solar CfD deployments, offshore wind projects (Hornsea 3)
- India: solar manufacturing and battery storage domestic content mandates
- Venezuela: oil-related geopolitics and US military actions
- Companies: Orsted (offshore wind), Apollo (offshore wind co-owner), Intel (semiconductors), Waaree Energies & Tata Power (solar)

---

## 4) Constraints / Risks Implied by Headlines
- US regulatory halts and opposition to offshore wind development projects (e.g., Orsted $5B project)
- Potential exit of Chinese solar manufacturers from key projects indicating project or financing risks
- Geopolitical instability (US-Venezuela conflict) impacting oil supply security and regional stability
- Vulnerability of critical data infrastructure (subsea cables) to sabotage or geopolitical influence
- Market and policy pressures on solar and battery industry pricing and domestic content requirements affecting supply chains

---
